1. INTRODUCTION 1. INTRODUCTION
--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----- --------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----
Stellarium is a free GPL software which renders realistic skies in real tim e Stellarium is a free GPL software which renders realistic skies in real tim e
with openGL. It is available for Linux/Unix, Windows and MacOSX. With Stell with openGL. It is available for Linux/Unix, Windows and MacOSX. With
arium, Stellarium, you really see what you can see with your eyes, binoculars or a
you really see what you can see with your eyes, binoculars or a small teles small telescope.
cope.

4. QUICK START 4. QUICK START
--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----- --------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----
Navigation : Navigation :
Use the direction keys or drag with the mouse to move the point of view. Use the direction keys or drag with the mouse to move the point of view.
Use page up and page down keys or mouse wheel to zoom in and out. Use page up and page down keys or mouse wheel to zoom in and out.
Use left mouse button to select an object, right button to select no object and Use left mouse button to select an object, right button to select no object and
middle mouse button or SPACE to center on the selected object. middle mouse button or SPACE to center on the selected object.
Zooming on nebulas or planets is very interesting.... Zooming on nebulas or planets is very interesting....
Use J, K and L to increment/decrement time speed. Use J, K and L to increment/decrement time speed.
Press the H key for more help. Press the F1 key for more help.
More help can be found on www.stellarium.org, and in the user guide. More help can be found on www.stellarium.org, and in the user guide.

5. CONFIGURATION 5. CONFIGURATION
--------------------------------------------------------------------------- ----- --------------------------------------------------------------------------- -----
From version 0.6.0 the most useful configuration options can be set from wi thin From version 0.6.0 the most useful configuration options can be set from wi thin
the program. the program.
You can however change it by hand in the file located in config/config.ini You can however change it by hand in the file config.ini in the user data
on directory. See http://www.stellarium.org/doc/head/fileStructure.html
Windows/MacOSX and in $HOME/.stellarium/ on a unix system. for more details on the location of the user data directory for your OS.

The changes made to the data are: The changes made to the data are:
-) try to compute visual magnitude and color from the b,v,r -) try to compute visual magnitude and color from the b,v,r
values values
-) compute nr_of_measurements = the number of valid b,v,r va lues -) compute nr_of_measurements = the number of valid b,v,r va lues
-) throw away or keep stars (depending on magnitude, -) throw away or keep stars (depending on magnitude,
nr_of_measurements, combination of flags, tycho2 number) nr_of_measurements, combination of flags, tycho2 number)
-) add all stars from hiparcos (incl. component solutions), -) add all stars from hiparcos (incl. component solutions),
and tycho2+1st supplement and
-) reorganize the stars in several brigthness levels and tri tycho2+1st supplement
angular -) reorganize the stars in several brigthness levels and
zones according to position and magnitude triangular zones according to position and magnitude

"MakeCombinedCatalogue", "ParseHip", "ParseNomad", "MakeCombinedCatalogue", "ParseHip", "ParseNomad", and can b
and can be found in the util subdirectory in source code. e

coming from NOMAD are unchanged, except for a possible magnitudes, and proper motions of the stars coming from NOMA
loss of precision, especially in magnitude. When there is no D
v-magnitude, it is estimated from r or b magnitude. are unchanged, except for a possible loss of precision,
When there is no b- or v- magnitude, the color B-V is estima especially in magnitude. When there is no v-magnitude, it is
ted from estimated from r or b magnitude. When there is no b- or v-
the other magnitudes. magnitude, the color B-V is estimated from the other magnitu
des.
